repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes #36577. See that issue for the rational behind this change.

Also fixes a bug where `:confirm restart +qall!` would incorrectly prompt for confirmation (despite `:confirm qall!` not doing so). I made sure to add a test case for this as well.

comment_data.body: I'm quite new to C, so I'd like feedback on whether this is the correct way to prepend a static string. I tested it and it works fine, but I'm still not the best at catching memory issues.

```suggestion
                Example: discard changes and stop with `:qall`, then restart: >
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -73,25 +73,23 @@ Restart Nvim
 :restart [+cmd] [command]
                 Restarts Nvim.
 
-                1. Stops Nvim using `:qall!` (or |+cmd|, if given).
+                1. Stops Nvim using `:qall` (or |+cmd|, if given).
                 2. Starts a new Nvim server using the same |v:argv|,
                    optionally running [command] at startup. |-c|
                 3. Attaches the current UI to the new Nvim server. Other UIs
                    (if any) will not reattach on restart (this may change in
                    the future).
 
-                Use with `:confirm` to prompt if changes have been made.
-
-                Example: stop with `:qall!`, then restart: >
+                Example: discard changes and stop with `:qall!`, then restart: >

comment_data.body: This is intentional. This used to be documentation that `:restart` was equal to `:restart +qall!` which was not communicated clearly and was already explained in other parts of the documentation. When changing `+qall!` to `+qall`, instead of keeping this example, I thought it would be better to add a new example showing how you can use `:restart +qall!` to discard changes and restart. It just happens to resemble the old thing in the diff.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -73,25 +73,23 @@ Restart Nvim
 :restart [+cmd] [command]
                 Restarts Nvim.
 
-                1. Stops Nvim using `:qall!` (or |+cmd|, if given).
+                1. Stops Nvim using `:qall` (or |+cmd|, if given).
                 2. Starts a new Nvim server using the same |v:argv|,
                    optionally running [command] at startup. |-c|
                 3. Attaches the current UI to the new Nvim server. Other UIs
                    (if any) will not reattach on restart (this may change in

comment_data.body: Ohh I see, thank you for explaining!

@@ -73,25 +73,23 @@ Restart Nvim

                 Restarts Nvim.
 
-                1. Stops Nvim using `:qall!` (or |+cmd|, if given).
+                1. Stops Nvim using `:qall` (or |+cmd|, if given).
                 2. Starts a new Nvim server using the same |v:argv|,

comment_data.body: I don't think this is needed at all. `CMOD_CONFIRM` is still active inside `nvim_command()`.

Unless I'm missing something, it looks like that's not right. Commenting out this conditional breaks `:confirm` (but `:set confirm | restart` still works).

Functionally, `:confirm restart +cmd` is sugar for `:restart +confirm\ cmd`.
Ah right, I forgot that `parse_command_modifiers()` clears it.
Wrong place. This should be moved after the next `gui_running_check()`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -391,14 +391,24 @@ describe('TUI :restart', function()
     screen:expect({ any = vim.pesc('Save changes to "Untitled"?') })
     tt.feed_data('N\013')
 
+    -- Check ":confirm restart +echo" correctly ignores ":confirm"
+    tt.feed_data(':confirm restart +echo\013')
+    screen:expect({ any = vim.pesc('+cmd did not quit the server') })
+

comment_data.body: Good catch! I was wondering why the tests were suddenly failing.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -391,14 +391,24 @@ describe('TUI :restart', function()
     screen:expect({ any = vim.pesc('Save changes to "Untitled"?') })
     tt.feed_data('N\013')
 
+    -- Check ":confirm restart +echo" correctly ignores ":confirm"
+    tt.feed_data(':confirm restart +echo\013')
+    screen:expect({ any = vim.pesc('+cmd did not quit the server') })
+

comment_regular_data.body: Not sure why the bot didn't add anyone for review. @MariaSolOs @justinmk could I please have a review?

> Not sure why the bot didn't add anyone for review. @MariaSolOs @justinmk could I please have a review?

that's because no one is tagged as reviewers of `ex_cmds`.

> You are leaking memory

Thanks for checking that! I'm still very inexperienced with C. I assume I need to free `quit_cmd_copy`, then?
@zeertzjq How does the memory safety look now? I think I fixed it but I'd like to confirm.
Apologies for all of the pushes. We should be good now.

title: feat(ex_cmds): consistent :restart behavior
